UARC.description: DOD-sponsored research center at a university maintaining essential research capabilities.

UAS.description: Aircraft system operated without a human pilot on board.

UC APL.description: DISA list of IT and telecommunications products certified for interoperability and security on DOD unified communications networks.

UCC.description: Comprehensive set of laws governing commercial transactions in the United States, adopted in some form by all states; federal contracts are governed by FAR rather than UCC.

UCMJ.description: Federal law establishing the military justice system for the armed forces.

UEI.description: SAM-generated identifier replacing the DUNS number for federal entity registration.

UIPA.description: Model state legislation governing the collection, maintenance, and dissemination of personal information by government agencies.

UMRA.description: Federal law (P.L. 104-4) requiring CBO to estimate the costs of unfunded mandates in proposed legislation and requiring agencies to assess the effects of regulations on state, local, and tribal governments.

UNICOR.description: Government corporation employing federal inmates to produce goods and services.

Uniform Guidance.full: Uniform Administrative Requirements, Cost Principles, and Audit Requirements for Federal Awards
Uniform Guidance.description: Consolidated guidance (2 CFR Part 200) establishing government-wide requirements for federal grants and cooperative agreements, replacing OMB Circulars A-87, A-110, A-122, and A-133.

USA.description: Military service branch responsible for land-based military operations.

USA FREEDOM Act.full: Uniting and Strengthening America by Fulfilling Rights and Ensuring Effective Discipline Over Monitoring Act
USA FREEDOM Act.description: Federal law (P.L. 114-23) reforming NSA bulk data collection programs, requiring more targeted surveillance under FISA, and increasing transparency of the FISC.

USA PATRIOT.full: Uniting and Strengthening America by Providing Appropriate Tools Required to Intercept and Obstruct Terrorism
USA PATRIOT.description: Full title of the PATRIOT Act (P.L. 107-56), the comprehensive post-9/11 law expanding surveillance, information sharing, and anti-terrorism authorities.

USACE.full: United States Army Corps of Engineers
USACE.description: Army command providing engineering services for public and military construction.

USAF.description: Military service branch responsible for air and space operations.

USAID.full: United States Agency for International Development
USAID.description: Independent agency administering civilian foreign aid and development assistance.

USASpending.description: Official source for federal spending data, tracking awards and agency budgets.

USC.description: Codification of federal statutory law organized by subject matter.

USCG.description: Military service branch responsible for maritime law enforcement and safety under DHS.

USCIS.full: United States Citizenship and Immigration Services
USCIS.description: DHS agency administering immigration and naturalization services.

USD(A&S).full: Under Secretary of Defense for Acquisition and Sustainment
USD(A&S).description: DOD official responsible for acquisition and sustainment policy and oversight.

USD(AT&L).full: Under Secretary of Defense for Acquisition, Technology and Logistics
USD(AT&L).description: Former DOD position overseeing defense acquisition, now split into USD(A&S) and USD(R&E).

USD(R&E).full: Under Secretary of Defense for Research and Engineering
USD(R&E).description: DOD official responsible for research, engineering, and technology development.

USDA.description: Federal department responsible for food, agriculture, and rural development policy.

USDS.description: EOP team using technology and design to improve government services.

USERRA.full: Uniformed Services Employment and Reemployment Rights Act
USERRA.description: Federal law (38 U.S.C. 4301 et seq.) protecting the civilian employment rights of military service members, reservists, and veterans returning from active duty.

USGS.description: DOI bureau providing scientific information about natural hazards, resources, and ecosystems.

USICH.full: United States Interagency Council on Homelessness
USICH.description: Federal agency coordinating the response to homelessness across government agencies.

USMC.description: Military service branch providing expeditionary and amphibious capabilities.

USMLE.description: Multi-step examination for medical licensure in the United States.

USMS.description: DOJ agency providing security for the federal judiciary and apprehending fugitives.

USN.description: Military service branch responsible for naval operations and maritime defense.

USPS.description: Independent agency operating the national postal service.

USSF.description: Military service branch responsible for space operations, under the Department of the Air Force.

USTR.full: Office of the United States Trade Representative
USTR.description: EOP office responsible for developing and coordinating U.S. trade policy.

VA.description: Federal department providing benefits, healthcare, and services to military veterans.

VA-FSS.description: VA-managed supply schedules for pharmaceuticals, medical equipment, and healthcare products available to VA and other federal healthcare facilities.

VAAR.description: VA supplement to the FAR with department-specific procurement policies including veteran-owned small business preferences.

VAWA.description: Federal law (P.L. 103-322, Title IV) providing federal resources for the investigation and prosecution of violent crimes against women and supporting victim services.

VECP.description: Contractor-submitted proposal under FAR Part 48 that proposes a contract change to reduce life-cycle costs while maintaining required performance.

VERA.description: OPM authority allowing agencies to offer early retirement to employees at age 50 with 20 years of service, or any age with 25 years, during restructuring.

VETS 2.description: GSA Best-in-Class GWAC exclusively set aside for Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Businesses providing IT solutions, with a $6.1 billion ceiling.

VEVRAA.full: Vietnam Era Veterans' Readjustment Assistance Act
VEVRAA.description: Federal law (38 U.S.C. 4212) requiring federal contractors to take affirmative action to employ and advance covered veterans, enforced by OFCCP.

VistA.full: Veterans Health Information Systems and Technology Architecture
VistA.description: VA integrated electronic health record system supporting clinical, administrative, and financial functions across VA medical centers.

VOSB.description: Small business designation for firms owned and controlled by veterans.

VPOTUS.full: Vice President of the United States
VPOTUS.description: Second-highest officer in the executive branch and president of the Senate.

VSIP.description: Authority allowing agencies to offer lump-sum payments up to $25,000 to incentivize employees to voluntarily separate during downsizing.

WARN Act.full: Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification Act
WARN Act.description: Federal law (29 U.S.C. 2101 et seq.) requiring employers with 100+ employees to provide 60 days advance notice of plant closings and mass layoffs.

WAWF.description: DOD electronic invoicing and receipt system enabling contractors to submit invoices and government personnel to process payments.

WBS.description: Hierarchical decomposition of project work into manageable components.

WDOL.description: System providing prevailing wage rates for service and construction contracts.

WIC.description: USDA supplemental nutrition program for pregnant women, new mothers, and young children.

WIG.description: Periodic pay increase within a GS grade based on acceptable performance and time in grade.

WIOA.description: Federal law (P.L. 113-128) authorizing job training and employment services through the public workforce system, replacing the Workforce Investment Act.

WMATA.description: Transit authority operating Metrorail and Metrobus in the DC metro area.

WMD.description: Nuclear, chemical, biological, and radiological weapons causing mass casualties.

WOSB.description: Small business designation for firms owned and controlled by women.

WOSB-SA.description: Acquisition restricted to WOSB or EDWOSB concerns in industries where women are substantially underrepresented.

WPA.description: Federal law (5 U.S.C. 2302(b)(8)) protecting federal employees who disclose evidence of waste, fraud, abuse, or threats to public health or safety from retaliation.

WPEA.description: Federal law (P.L. 112-199) strengthening protections for federal whistleblowers by clarifying protected disclosures and enhancing remedies, amending the Whistleblower Protection Act.

WR.description: Hourly pay rate established for a specific labor category, often per SCA or DBA requirements.

XDR.description: Cybersecurity approach extending EDR capabilities across network, cloud, and email security layers for unified threat detection.

ZTA.description: Security model requiring verification for every user and device accessing resources.
